frameDefinitions: A Selector, often an individual in a leadership role, appoints a Official to assume an official Role in an organization (which can be expressed as the Body).
This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.
This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
In this frame, which is a  part of the Trial sequence, a Judge gives a Finding with respect to the Charges against the Defendant in a particular Case.
This frame describes an Agent's gathering of Individuals (people or entities) into a group, the  Aggregate, defined by relative proximity.
frameExamples: Press secretaries <t>accredit</t> journalists to the sessions.
On March 17 , Mamedov <t>appointed</t> Rakhim Gasiyev as Defence Minister .
In certain fertility <t>rites</t> in Burma , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .
He was <t>convicted</t> of fraud by Judge Judy.
The police <t>gathered</t> the suspects into a line-up.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Selector</fen> is responsible for the appointment of the new official.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.
The <fen>Official</fen> is a person appointed to a recognized position.

Frequently, the <fen>Official</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement (headed by <m>as</m>).
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>Official</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function, and to which the <fen>Official</fen> is assigned.
When the designation of the official takes place.
Where the appointment takes place.
The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership.  Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.

With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the <fen>Old_leader</fen> is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition <ment>against</ment>.
With words denoting appointment to a position, the <fen>New_leader</fen> is typically the object of verbs.

Frequently the <fen>Old_leader</fen> or <fen>New_leader</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement.
The role <fen>Old_order</fen> identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs.
The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>New_leader</fen> will fufill.
A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.
When the change takes place.
Where the change takes place.
This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
The role <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
This role identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
This role identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
This role indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
When the rite is performed
Where the rite takes place.
The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.
This role identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE.
The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.
This role refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.
The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
This role identifies the aggregate that results from the gathering.  It may be expressed either as an adjunct result phrase or as a direct object of a target verb.
Agent is the person who gathers Individuals.
This role identifies the entities that come together to form an Aggregate.

This role identifies the time when the gathering event occurs, if specified.
The crowd assembled <fex name='Time'>at dawn</fex>.

This role identifies the place where the gathering event occurs.
He <t>assembled</t> the children <fex name='Place'>in the hall</fex>.
listRoleExamples: Under the new program, SCC will accredit organizations <fex>to assess wood flow from certified forests to workshops or factories</fex>.
<fex>The voters</fex> elected Blair.
The students overthrew <fex>the president</fex>.
The president appoints <fex>the prime minister</fex>.
The board of directors appointed Ashton <fex>Acting President</fex>.
The rebels overthrew <fex>the dictatorship</fex>.
His district elected her  <fex>to Congress</fex> three times.
The <fex>2000</fex> coup against the dictator was led by former president Smith.
The crew mutinied <fex>out in the middle of the Atlantic</fex>, the scoundrels.
<fex>The medicine man</fex> performs this ritual
<fex>Joe</fex> received communion.
His baptism <fex>into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.
We baptise children <fex>with holy water</fex>
They performed a <fex>fertility</fex> ritual.
We performed the traditional <fex>marriage</fex> rites
The priest blessed <fex>the wine</fex>
Elliott was almost ordained <fex>as a priest</fex>
<fex>Mr. and Mrs. Wilson</fex> baptized their son.
The police gathered the suspects <fex>into a line-up</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> gathered the suspects into a lineup.
The police gathered <fex>the suspects</fex> into a line-up.
